commit.message:
Toolkit.java (getSystemEventQueue, [...]): Replace UTF-8 characters in Javadoc by XML/HTML escape sequence.

2003-09-18  Sascha Brawer  <brawer@dandelis.ch>

	* java/awt/Toolkit.java (getSystemEventQueue, getSystemEventQueueImpl):
	Replace UTF-8 characters in Javadoc by XML/HTML escape sequence.

From-SVN: r71549

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,8 @@
+2003-09-18  Sascha Brawer  <brawer@dandelis.ch>
+
+	* java/awt/Toolkit.java (getSystemEventQueue, getSystemEventQueueImpl):
+	Replace UTF-8 characters in Javadoc by XML/HTML escape sequence.
+
 2003-09-18  Tom Tromey  <tromey@redhat.com>
 
 	* javax/naming/InitialContext.java: Reindented.

@@ -807,7 +807,7 @@ public static String getProperty(String key, String def) /** * Returns the event queue that is suitable for the calling context. * - *

Despite the word “System” in the name of this + *

Despite the word “System” in the name of this * method, a toolkit may provide different event queues for each * applet. There is no guarantee that the same queue is shared * system-wide. @@ -842,7 +842,7 @@ public final EventQueue getSystemEventQueue() /** * Returns the event queue that is suitable for the calling context. * - *

Despite the word “,System”, in the name of this + *

Despite the word “System” in the name of this * method, a toolkit may provide different event queues for each * applet. There is no guarantee that the same queue is shared * system-wide.
